nodes.bodyText: Is intentional to have operators twice? (before and after constraints rules) If yes, I don't see the reason.

Yes, it is because the operators need to be optimized before and after the new filters are added otherwise they'll be missed.
For example the filter where a + 1 > 2 + 3 or true will be skipped due to or. Further more there's folding and potentially some range combinations that might apply.
Likewise, after the new constraint was added, the filters need to be combined and potentially the resulting condition improved:
where a > 1
where a == 0
These two filters would be combined into one then another rule would pick it up and make the filter false which would result in the sequence being skipped.

Do you mind adding a simple explanation in the form of an example to each test? I find it easier to follow.
For this one:
sequence
 [event where a > 1] by a
 [event where timestamp == true] by a
I think this test method is not gonna be picked up. You probably meant testSameTwoKeysConstraints
